result.execSummary:
The defendant Krystle A Plotkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: At the day reporting center.  Court would allow for GPS release after 2 months confinement.

*May 4, 2017  To serve 135 days. Straight time. No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.
*8/18/2017 amended to 91 days beginning 05/04/2017.

records.addlTxt:
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Cimpl  for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 21 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 4 months and 15 days condition time at the day reporting center.  Court would allow for GPS release after 2 months confinement.  
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Nick Cerwin for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM032254  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-03-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   
No use or possession of controlled substances.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in custody.  
Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Return on warrant.  Hearing proceeded.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court sets bail at $250.00 CASH WIT TOT JUSTICE POINT FOR SUPERVISION.  Parties engaged in negotiations, defense awaiting offer.  Parties advised effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Krystle A Plotkin not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Return on Warrant hearing.  The Court is unable to hear this matter due to the lateness of the hour (5pm).  Case to be heard on 6-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Return on warrant scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant date scheduled for 6/25/2015 at 1:30 pm. Parties notified.
No reply from surety/defendant.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until
3/31/2015. Case calendared for CALENDAR CALL on 3/31/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needs to obtain an offer from the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for attorney Alexis Liggins. David Behm for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 3/4/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court.  Attorney Alexis Liggins via telephone, as she is out ill.  David John Behm appears for the State of Wisconsin.   She does not feel that she will be back to work this week.  Because there are time constrains, Attorney Liggins will have someone from their office handle this matter.  Attorney Liggins also thinks defendant may be obtaining private counsel.  ith attorney Alexis Liggins.  Arraignment scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Nicole Sheldon for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO DA FILED IN COURT.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Krystle A Plotkin in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
